reviews.text: Just returned from Dreams on April 27...Our stay was wonderful. Checking in was a breeze. Did have a couple of issues. We booked two rooms in the old tower. One room was beatiful 1608 the other 1601 appeared to not have been used in a long long time. Example: dirty slidding doors, old dusty bedding, no pictures, no rugs, mini refergirator not stocked, no glasses and so on.
reviews.title: Relaxing vacation

likes.disliked: — Staff not as friendly as other resorts I have stayed at...Pools very small not enjoyable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let the front desk know right away, and they put us on a long list of guest requesting a different room.
reviews.title: Dreams was wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also asked for the mattress padding as others had suggested. I don't recommend doing this. They put on the bed old couch cushions that had what appeared to be oil stains and such all over. (I wouldn't let my dog sleep on them) took them off. Next day they offered to move us to a different room but on a different floor away from our kids. We declined they asked what they could do we said just make our room look like the others. And they did! Brought up rugs, new bedding, glasses everything. We were very happy.
reviews.title: The Sweetest Dream
great all-inclusive
reviews.text: Food was great in all resturants.
All rooms have a wonderful view!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Best Service Ever
Very Good Value
reviews.text: I rate Dreams Puerto Vallarta as a solid 4.25 stars.
Above Average:
reviews.title: Fabulous way to spend my honeymoon!

reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Best vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful “standard” room. Spectacular sweeping ocean and mountain views, amazingly comfortable beds with extra-thick pillow-top mattresses, sitting area with sofa, chair and coffee table, eating area with table and chairs, modern flat screen TV with satellite channels and IPOD docking station. Absolutely no noise carry over from adjoining rooms.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons.. 7.5 out of 10

reviews.text: Food
reviews.title: Was very impressed, Would recommend
The adventures of an “ugly” American or Bring back the Loveboat
reviews.text: Went to Puerto Vallarta for the first time with my wife and 13 year old. I read all the reviews before I arranged the trip. Liked the Dreams location from what I could see online even though I thought the Westin and Marriott in Marina Vallarta looked like nicer hotels. I have been to Cancun and Cozumel before and really enjoyed both places. I came to Puerto Vallarta and Dreams knowing that Mexico is different than the U.S. Heck, that's why I wanted go to begin with. I know that the service is slower. I know that people are poorer and therefore try to sell you things that you don't need or want. That's what you call cultural differences and that is what makes the world go round.

reviews.title: Loved it but something happened (6/12/06--6/18/06
reviews.text: Against this backdrop, I was set on going to Puerto Vallarta, having a great time and proving to all of you reviewers on TripAdvisor that I would show you how to travel without being the typical "ugly" American. In fact, when we were being taken to our rooms upon arrival, I overheard another American tourist complain aloud that there was no air conditioning in the elevator. I leaned over and whispered to my wife "what an ugly American". Little did I suspect how those words would come back to haunt me several days later when my wife, stepson and 3 other guests got stuck in the same elevator. I had read on someone's reviews that there had been trouble with the elevators and I had seen them being repaired every day during our stay. For some reason, I just wasn't worried about it. Well believe you me, there is nothing more frightening than being stuck in an unairconditioned elevator in Mexico. The heat was overwhelming and I was not overly impressed with the staff's sense of urgency about the whole thing even though we were only trapped for about 10 to 15 minutes. Perhaps that experience tainted my view of Dreams and Puerto Vallarta somewhat but there were definitely other things that bothered me.
Here is a summary of my impressions of Puerto Vallarta and Dreams
reviews.title: Dreams, not a 4 star

reviews.text: (1) First of all, just like the U.S. and Mexico are very different from each other so is Puerto Vallarta very different from the Cancun/Cozumel region. I must admit that Puerto Vallarta itself just didn't do it for me aesthetically the way Cancun and Cozumel did. I knew the water would not be the same color but there is no question in my mind that Puerto Vallarta itself (Dreams included) is not kept as clean as Cancun and Cozumel are. Unfortunately, there are a lot of unpleasant odors, whether it be in town or at Dreams. That trench that I read about online which exists between the Old Tower and the primary pool is really unattractive and appears to have some sort of waste leaking into it. It smells bad. It needs to be attended to. They burn incense in the hotel lobby but that really does not cover up the smells when you get closer to the source.
reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong

reviews.text: (2) Much as I had suspected, the Dreams location is probably the best location in the city. It is only 5-10 minutes away from town and is secluded on prime real estate with a drop dead gorgeous beach etched into lush green, tropical mountains. Cannot complain about that at all. We actually went to the Marina Vallarta area to take a look at the Westin and it was a better looking hotel with much, much better looking pool facilities but the downside was the Marina district is just plain ugly with little natural beauty and a beach with brown sand.
reviews.title: Going to P.V??? Stay Here!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: I have waited for several months to write this review of the Dreams. WE took a family vacation this past March and stayed at the Dreams for a week. We had a terrible thing happen at the Dreams and the hotel did nothing to help us. The only person that was any help at all was the Doctor on duty. He is wonderful. However, the hotel management and staff were horrible. We will never stay at the Dreams again due to the terrible experience that our family had at the hotel. One of our family members will have memories of the Dreams etched into the side of his neck for years to come with a five inch scar due to something that happened at the Dreams. Also, the rooms are not nice. They are old in a matter of fact. The food for the most part is ok and the service at most restaurants is good. The Mexican Restaurant has the best service and probably the best food. We also loved the beach and the water.
reviews.title: Dreams was not good to our family

reviews.text: Where to start?
reviews.title: Dreams was amazing!!! You will not be disappointed!
Dreams is doing it right!!!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Dreams May 30-June 6. Neither of us had ever been to Puerto Vallarta before, so we were a little nervous after reading all the reviews online. We had NOTHING to be nervous about!

reviews.title: I give Dream's a B
reviews.text: We were greeting by the bellman opening the doors to our cab and helping us out and taking all our luggage. We were each handed a glass of champagne when we got to the check in desk. We had a junior suite in the club tower, I guess that's the "newer" of the two towers. Honestly, the room would be our one complaint, and that was such a minor detail, we didn't care at all!

reviews.title: Loved the Dreams Resort
reviews.text: The room was very spacious, and the balcony view was amazing. Worth every penny! Our mini-bar was stocked daily, bottled water, coke and diet coke, and mini coronas. Our bed was turned down every night, and each night we were left a detailed sheet with the next day's activities. Our safe, air conditioning and our room keys worked the entire time, unlike other reviews I read. The bed was hard, yes....but not awful. Some people had mentioned asking for an additonal pad on the bed, we actually had one already when we got there! The rooms definately need a face lift, but it's nothing awful. We noticed some patchwork on the walls, and the paint was chipping in places. Nothing huge, just little things we noticed.

reviews.title: Dream PVR
reviews.text: This was our 1st time staying at a Dreams Resort. We had the best time and can't wait to return. The staff was very friendly, accomodating and went out of their way each and every time. We have stayed at many hotels/resorts and this our 2nd All Inclusive. The 1st experience was at at Rui resort and it was terrible. We thought lets try one more time Al. The Dreams was beyond my expectations. Great staff, very clean, wonderful food and great entertaining. I am ready to book another trip for our aniversary in September. I plan on trying a differenct location in Mexico either Secrets in Cancun or Dreams in Cabo. Plan to go back to Dreams in PVR next spring. Schulze family ORD.

I had the rare opportunity to book 2 back to back trips in 3 weeks to Puerto Vallarta. The first time I stayed at the Dreams in Nueovo Vallarta, and the second time I stayed at the Dreams in Puerto Vallarta.
reviews.title: Dreams Nuevo Vallarta vs. Dreams Puerto Vallarta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One my first day there, when the staff found out that I've stayed at the Nuevo Vallarta Dreams, they asekd me which one was better. My answer was I will let them know after my stay. Well.....
reviews.title: Beautiful Beach and So Relaxing.. Service was So-So
Preferred Tower is Nice, Dreams Tower is a Motel 6 and not 4 star
reviews.text: Here is what I've experienced in comparison:
1. Amenity-filled rooms and suites all with ocean views overlooking the blue-green Pacific and private beach:
reviews.title: Difference in the buildings is HUGE

reviews.text: We recently returned from a trip; April 21-29. We arrived early and was given our room on the 8th (18th) floor of the old tower. The bell boy gave us great instructions for the hotel and the room. We had a great view of the bay. The glass slider opened and it was like our whole room was the balcony. The ambiance of music, insence, and candle-lit walkways was wonderful. I especially loved the pelicans patrolling the beach. Everyone was freindly and nice. The vendors on the beach are very nice and seemed to care less if you bought anything or not. (I think they work for the hotel)They did have nice things though and my wife bought some nice jewelery.
reviews.title: Vacation in paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the good things I read were correct. Use the yellow cabs. Tips are included but I wouldn't feel right not giving them, they are appreciated. When you go to town, just say no to the time share people, they are just doing their job. If you buy in town, talk down the price(unless it is a fixed store).
reviews.title: A relaxing get away

likes.liked: — Sucluded property, al la carta restuarants, with no reservations, swim up bar.
likes.disliked: — not enough chairs, more supervison at the adult pool and adult restuarant, too many kids sometimes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Elpatio restaurant was very(as were the others) but Elpatio has air conditioning and is the only enclosed place. The food is great and also the staff. If you want to drink some tequila, this is the spot.
reviews.title: Second Visit

likes.liked: — An all inclusive without wristbands and no reservations required at the specialty restaurants. Great service staff.
likes.disliked: — The room showed where and tear.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Day trips are good, we did the dolphin swim, it was great, we took a cab to Barcello( a hotel down the road) then a speedboat to the dolphin marina. If you like animals this is for you.
reviews.title: Great for the $$$$

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will go back to this hotel again, anyone who went here and didn't have a job good time never wanted to have a good time in the first place. mechanic81@juno.com
reviews.title: March Vacation at Dreams

reviews.text: We had all of our guests stay here and they LOVED it. We booked a year in advance and I'm glad we did. We got an incredible deal from a great travel agent and our guests loved the all-inclusive. Definitely stay in the new tower, its gorgeous!! Best restaurant is the Italian one. Worst one is the Mexican one. Staff can be a bit dizty, but hey, we didn't mind.
reviews.title: WOW!! This is THE BEST Hotel in Puerto Vallarta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Appreciated the hospitality and kindness of the adventure/activities team. In particular, Alex, Ramon, and Paco, made this experience pleasurable. Would recommend the hotel based on these three individuals alone. Always kept an up-beat attitude, and always tried to get everyone involved.
reviews.title: Excellent service, great Vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here the first week of June. We absolutely loved this resort. We had a little trouble with our room not being available due to our early arrival; however, the staff was quick to get us fed, some drinks in our hand, and even provided another room for a short siesta time as we waited for our room to become available.
reviews.title: An Excellent Resort - Ditto all other positive reviews!

reviews.text: World Cafe is a good starting point for the day and provides many selections for breakfast. Also, ate lunch there on a couple of days. Our favorite restaurant was the Seaside Grill due to both the food and the service. We were only able to dine at Oceana once and wished we could have gone back, but our short stay and the restaurant schedule put a damper on those plans. Portofino was okay but nothing special; probably should have gone to Oceana.
reviews.title: Best vacation, will return soon!!!
beware of booking this resort thru continental vacation packages
reviews.text: The room was excellent. From the bed, pillows, mattress, bathroom amenities, we were never less than satisfied. The view from the 8th floor was exceptional. We did book a room with a jacuzzi on the balcony and enjoyed each morning and evening with a bubbly soak. The incense is such a nice little touch as well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me preface this by saying we go on several different kinds of vacations - the kind where you see the world in 30 days, the kind where you spend 2 days working and 1 day seeing family, the kind where you are just really there to indulge your kids, and this one - the kind where you really, truly, just want to relax and enjoy yourself. While Dreams would not be my choice for an exploring "let's learn about what life is really like in Mexico" vacation - it was the perfect choice for our "we really need to de-stress" vacation.
reviews.title: A peaceful, enjoyable vacation.
A great resort and a relaxing vacation!
reviews.text: Dreams is what it says it is - a Mexican true all-inclusive. As such, you can count on the following:
- solid, friendly service (everything is not a yes, but all of our reasonable and a few unreasonable requests made in a polite manner were honored happily)
reviews.title: Dreams Puerto Vallarta is awesome!!!
A Pleasant and Convenient All Inclusive Resort
reviews.text: - a lot of English speaking employees (but a few who don't, it is nice to try a little Spanish)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - some meals likely as buffets (works for us, some people hate them on principle)
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: We vacationed @ Dreams with our 2 adult children (ages 24 &27)
reviews.title: Reviews rang true !

reviews.text: We all had a great time. Our meals were wonderful in all the restaurants, the beach was great ,the weather could not be better. I was really surprised @ how nice the theme night buffets were.my children enjoyed the various bars on site & we all enjoyed trying "the drink of the day " We were able to watch the NY TV stations & CNN,& get USA Today after 4pm in the afternoon. The maids came twice a day & replenished towels in the evening. Our rooms were in the Old tower & we did have some minor issues which were readily fixed when the front desk was called.
reviews.title: Dreams was NOT a dream

likes.disliked: — food, getting an umbrella or shade, lack of cleanliness, ear-piercing music at the pool, constant construction

reviews.text: The cab ride to town was short & very inexpensive. PV town was a lot of fun. We felt very safe walking around.
reviews.title: Fabulour Dreams Destination Wedding

likes.disliked: — They could use some more palapas and chairs. They tended to fill up quickly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After going in to town I did feel comfortable buying blankets & beach cover-ups from the vendors on the beach @ the resort. They were never a bother & their prices were fair. i found it easier to deal with their selection of clothes & blankets then in the flea market ,though everyone was polite in both venues.
reviews.title: Fantastic Honeymoon

likes.liked: — The ease of having everything paid for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did buy some pieces of jewelry in town as they had more of a selection. Twice during the week they had vendors come to the resort in the evening & they had a larger selection to choose from there & that was convenient. We used Trip advisor as a reference when we picked Dreams & we found the reviews very helpful
reviews.title: Dreams was a Dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Dreams for our honeymoon in August 2006. Our wedding was in Oregon, but we live in Arizona, so the honeymoon was mostly lounging around the resort. It was hot, and humid! The sand was too hot to walk barefoot on for a few days, but it did rain and cooled everything off. Although this was also vacation season in Mexico, the hot weather probably played a part in the low amount of people at the resort, which I was happy about! I have recommended this resort to family and friends, and will definitely be going back again in 2007. I have stayed at a few other all-inclusive resorts (in Jamaica) and this one was up there with some of the best. Just remember, you are in Mexico, not the US. That is my biggest tip! Anyway, the resort was great for families and for couples. Less for singles looking to party. We stayed in a jr suite in the new tower, which has free 24 hr room service and a balcony. There are jr suites with hot tubs on the balcony too!
reviews.title: Dreams PV: Amazing!!!

likes.liked: — huge, beautiful rooms, amazing food, LOCATION!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TRAVEL: Flew AWA (USAirways). Airport is tiny. Customs lines were long! Picking up a cab was nerve-racking. I was not aware of what the price should be, so we paid $25US for the ride to Dreams, but it should cost way less than that if you feel comfortable haggling prices. The resort is pretty far from the airport but the cabbie took us through downtown, past the Melecon, so we had a chance to see a lot of the city. The roads were a mess, so plan for at least 30-45 min to get back to the airport to be safe.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: RESORT: The resort is gated and has many security guards. Guests have to give their room number to get in and out. Beach is private, so all of the people that sell items on the beach are cleared with the hotel. It was rainy season and everything was very green and beautiful, entrance was not grand, but it was beautiful. The lobby is open air, and we receive champagne and a damp towel upon arrival. Check in was quick and our room was ready (it was about 3pm when we arrived). I heard many people complaining about their keys cards not working, but it's not really the big deal they were making it. Chill out!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort prints a flyer every night for the next day’s events so you can make plans around resort. Definitely go to the Mexican night… there are tons of vendors, great food, and performances. When we were there, there was a theater company from Santa Barbara who put on a great show and the staff went around the resort gathering people to go. If this is going on, go and cheer them on, and please stay for the whole thing… They work really hard and it was a lot of fun!
reviews.title: A Paradise, We didn't want to leave!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TIPPING: We only tipped for extraordinary services. Waiters that went above and beyond, or when we ate at the beach. And for room service, especially when it was 2am and they were bringing me a hamburger! Tipping everyone for everything is not necessary or condoned, so don’t do it! Change your money into pesos in town (the resort gives a crappy exchange rate). Tips in pesos are okay, they like dollars more!
reviews.title: Absolute Perfection

likes.liked: — Beautiful views, great food, great beach, wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dreams Puerto Vallarta resort was one of the best vacations we had ever taken to an all-inclusive resort. It is one of the most beautiful places in the world.
reviews.title: First class all the way at Dreams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The direct flight from Los Angeles was seamless and the Tripadvisor advice about blasting thru the time-share hawkers when you leave customs was spot on. The cab option got us to the resort within thirty minutes; driving thru the old town, over the hills down to the resort nestled at the foot of the mountains in its own beautiful bay. It was way easier just to get a cab rather than do the group transfer and in the end faster to the resort. June is the rainy season so when we arrived the monsoon rain had just appeared and was gone within a few hours. This rain turned into a welcome reprieve at the end of beach day as we settled into a beach groove. It took the humidity out of the jungle air and created some remarkable sunsets.
reviews.title: Expect both positves and negatives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you arrive at the resort the first step is the full-on gated security with guest names on record. My partner loves a gate. The resort is very safe and this gate and security guards ensured that whom ever was on the property should be there. You wind down thru to the Lobby and a flood of bellboys welcome you and were ushered to the Preferred Tower. Again, winding thru to the tower the resort is very well kept and lush with staff all offering a smile and ‘Hola”. The Preferred lobby is beautiful, modern and has outstanding views of the ocean. Arriving at the front desks, we were seated and greeted by Adriana our concierge for our stay. Adriana really made our stay wonderful with attentive service and constant reminder for you to ‘just relax’. Somebody quickly came over and offered us a cocktail (perfect) and some canapés. This chap always had a smile always offered you something when you popped into the tower lounge. Unfortunately, our suite was not available with a King bed but only as with two double queens (This happens to us all the time traveling thru Latin America). It appeared that hotel was fully booked and the resort full. Even thou we did not get our room immediately they did manage to get us the King bed as asked. They honored the $200US resort credits and explained their use, which did come in handy.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great food, wonderful staff.

reviews.text: It was our anniversary so when we arrived the suite they had set with it with swans, fruit and champagne. It was a wonderful surprise and Adriana really went out to make sure that they remembered this special occasion. This is were the resort really out shined above many other 5 star resorts; when a small hitch happened (such as the double bed) they quickly and very personally made every effort for that minor discourse disappear and give you a bigger smile than before.
reviews.title: A beautiful resort but lots of issues with rooms and check-in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite is fantastic! Huge, modern and with amazing views of the pacific and mountains. We were on a high floor, which proved to be great when you needed to use the Jacuzzi and just soak and look over the monsoon ocean in the late afternoon. The bed was very comfortable with fantastic pillows and linens. The suite could be cooled and black out blinds closed so that you awoke to a very comfortable morning. The bathroom is huge, luxurious and has every amenity and utility needed. Another Jacuzzi tub, rain shower, double basins all in stone and glass. Because of this suite we spent breakfasts, very late dinners and snacks in our room. The room service was fantastic with food and drinks arriving quickly. Nice touches with bowls of fruit and champagne being offered and turning up in the day. Concha our housekeeper was fantastic always smiling and working incredibly hard to make sure the suite was always immaculate and comfortable. The turn down service was wonderful.
reviews.title: Good value for beach vacation

reviews.text: My partner and I just came back from Dreams resort and we had a blast. I did a lot of research on all-inclusive resorts in PV and was not let down with Dreams. They had everything for families and couples. We went to relax, eat and drink. and we enjoyed them all. There are many resorts in PV but this one feels natural. Like it belongs in this lush, green secluded location. It is not a concrete structure with a few palms and pools, but a beautiful rainforest like feel right on a private beach. Every room is ocean front. You fall asleep to the sound of waves crashing on the sandy beach. The food is good, not incredible. Incredible would only be achieved if prices were higher and food costs could be higher. But it's ALL u can eat so... The drinks are good and free premium liquor is readily available upon request... Including stoli, captain Morgan, Malibu, dewars, jack Daniels, absolut. Etc. $5 taxi trips to downtown PV takes 5min to get there. The older towner rooms need to be remodeled soon. They are clean but decorations seem like from the 90's but we spend so little time in the room. We mostly laid at the beautiful adult pool with the vanishing horizon overlooking the ocean or on the beach under umbrellas. Service was wonderful and we chatted with many of the friendly staff. Most spoke good English and we worked on our Spanish:) all in all 5 stars. We suggest you go and we are hoping to return next year with friends. Thank you Dreams. We left very happy. PS, tip!!! A dollar or two goes a long. Bring $100 in ones and share a little of your wealth.
reviews.title: Amazing getaway with the help of Dreams PV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dreams Puerto Vallarta Resort and Spa is a fantastic place. It is a good 15-20 minute ride to get to Dreams from the airport, but it is totally worth it, especially since you get that great secluded beach. As soon as you arrive you actually feel like a WELCOMED special guest, and not just another tourist.
reviews.title: Great Trip Despite Some Travel Woes!

reviews.text: After our complimentary champagne and check in, we were brought up to our room and loved it. We stayed in a suite in the preferred tower with a jacuzzi. After staying in this room, I say it is the way to go. The rooms are HUGE and the view up the coast from the balcony is breathtaking. Since it was our Anniversary, my wife and I received some fruit and champagne, both were great. Nothing can beat waking up every morning and seeing that view.
reviews.title: What a great place!
We will NEVER return
reviews.text: The employees at Dreams were top notch. All the way from the entertainers to the desk workers. The entertainers were a blast, they were very fun and had plenty of stuff lined up for guests to do every day. We really enjoyed the Kayak and Jungle trek. I would recommend doing both. There is no way you could be bored at this place with all the activities on-site.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants were good as well. Our favorite was Oceana, the steak and chicken were both fantastic, and the fried ice cream was just perfect to top it off. Our least favorite restaurant was the World Cafe buffet, but it was expected since it was a buffet. It was still good though.
reviews.title: Awesome Honeymoon

reviews.text: My wife, 2 kids (9,7), and I stayed at Dreams in July. We've gone to Mexico 3 years in a row now and this was our best trip yet. Our other two were at a Riu in Cancun and Crown Paradise in PV......Dreams beat them both. The food was very good overall with our favorites being Oceana (escargot and the meat dish) and the Sea Side Grill. We found the no wristband, no reservation system a plus and the free 24 hour room service made it so easy to relax in our room if need be. We utilized Coco's Cafe quite a bit for snacks. They have hot/cold drinks and quality pastries and sweets. We loved it. And believe it or not, the roll sushi at the buffet was as good as can be expected. That was our light lunch on several days. We spent most of our days at the pool. The main pool was busy and a little small, but they do have another pool that is shadier and quieter, making for a relaxing, comfortable day. The Explorer's Club was good, and open until 10pm, but we didn't use it very much because the girls were having a great time otherwise. Our girls loved the trampoline on the beach. Usually twice a day they had it available. Service? Very good, especially the front counter. But we did have to ask for enough towels/shampoo/soap more than once. The Rooms? Good, no problems sleeping. Entertainment? Daytime was low-key, but we found a couple things that we enjoyed. Nightime was so-so. We got taxis to/from the airport. It's 260 pesos from the airport and 150 pesos/$15 dollars going back. Easy. If you want to go into town, it's a $5 taxi or 7 pesos on the bus right out front. Either way, it's a quick 5 minute ride. Overall, our time at Dreams was fantastic and we were all disappointed to be leaving after 5 nights. We'd love to go back.
reviews.title: Best All-Inclusive Yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wanted to surprise my husband for his birthday with a romantic week at a high quality resort in Puerto Vallarta, and reserved us a room at Dreams based on internet searches and Trip Advisor recommendations. We had been to Puerto Vallarta many times as a stop on cruises but had never stayed for more than an afternoon, so it was important to try to pick a great place, sight-unseen. After checking out the Dreams website and reading all the great recommendations here, I felt confident that I was picking just the right place for his surprise week in paradise. And believe me, I was not disappointed (and neither was he!!!). Dreams Puerto Vallarta was like paradise on earth.
reviews.title: One word: PARADISE!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About a month before the trip I contacted Gregorio Robles, head concierce, and asked about arranging some special touches during our trip, like a bottle of wine waiting in the room when we arrived, a romantic couples massage, and the like. Gregorio was responsive, helpful, and answered my every email in a professional manner.
reviews.title: Fantastic food, beautiful, clean beach, relaxing atmosphere

reviews.text: Upon arrival at Dreams we were greeted with a cold glass of champagne and a cool cloth for our faces, and Salvador, concierge at the Preferred Tower, met us personally and got us checked in quickly and into our room. He offered us an upgrade to the penthouse suite for a VERY small fee, but we decided to stick with our jacuzzi suite on the 9th floor. The Preferred Club is WELL WORTH the little extra you must spend.
reviews.title: Wonderful Time had by all...Our Daughter's wedding was amazing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite was clean, well-appointed and had an awesome view!!! And sure enough, a bottle of chilled wine was waiting in the room, just as Gregorio had arranged. The bed was so comfortable, and the bathroom was gigantic! The jacuzzi was sort of like a bathtub jacuzzi on the balcony - you could fill it with hot or cool water depending on the time of day. At the end of our week we checked back with Salvadore to see if we could upgrade to the penthouse for the last 2 nights and it was possible for only $50 a day more so we did that and loved the penthouse just as much as our jacuzzi room, but the advantage was that there was a private cool pool on the balcony deep enough to submerge your whole body. Nice.
reviews.title: Best All-Inclusive EVER (so far)!!
Exceeded Our Expectations
reviews.text: I have to admit I was a little nervous before we got to Dreams for our honeymoon because we went specifially based off the reviews that had been written. All of these nerves were erased once we got there. We arrived and were immediately greeted by workers at the resort who grabbed our bags and welcomed us with champagne. The check in was effortless and we were immediately taken to our room. We had a junior suite with a jacuzzi on the balcony and the room was spaciuos, sunny, and comfortable. The views from the room are amazing.

We did not any problems with our safe that other people had, and though the beds were a little hard, they were still to our liking. The mini bar was a nice touch, and room service was quick and very accomodating with a decent selection of things.
reviews.title: A nice hotel
Missing the Dream
reviews.text: The food exceeded our expectations. The buffet for breakfast had many options so you could have something different anyday. My wife especially enjoyed the make your own omelette station. We liked Oceana best for dinner as it had some excellent seafood selections - definitely reccommend the 1/2 lobster and scallop dish. The Seaside Grill and Mexican place, El Patio were also excellent. The food at the Portofino was probably our least favorite, but still really good and an excellent ambience. All restaurants are on the water and I would suggest going to Oceana or Seaside for dinner while the sun is setting, as the sunsets are unreal.

The place was very clean as well, and though not 5 star in terms of the way it looked, the grounds are beautiful and we had no complaints. We liked the main pool with the swim up bar and daily activities, as well as the infinity pool whihc was right next to the Barracuda Bar. The beach was great as well. Nice sandy beaches, and they do drink service, as well as a hamburger/hot dog/nacho BBQ daily. Vendors are not a problem. There is also beach volleyball, free kayak and boogie board rental. We especially loved the water tramplone and iceberg that they put about 50 yards out in the ocean everyday. Fun to swim up to and do flips off of. You can rent jetskis, a boat, or parasailing but I assume they are a little pricey.
reviews.title: Great place, but be careful.
A "dream" come true vacation
reviews.text: Downtown Puerto Vallarta is only a 5 minute and $4 cab ride from Dreams and is worth checking out. Though not the cleanest it is charming and very authentic, it is nice to know that is "Real" Mexico, and not a planned tourist area like Cancun. We enjoyed going along the Malecon which is on the waterfront and barterting in the markets. We also enjoyed a nice romantic dinner at El Palomar which is on top of a huge hill and overlooks the entire city and Banderas Bay. The views are worth it and the food is both tasty and affordable.

I must preface this review by saying that this is a GREAT resort....a GREAT resort if you had nothing to compare it to. However, we've stayed in some great 5 star resorts and I cannot compare this to those in terms of quality or 'bang for your buck.' I think that this resort deserves a "7" maybe a 7.5? Also, this ius very long; as I want any potential travelers to get a sense of what we had. But, obviously, you can only judge for yourself.
reviews.title: So, what's hot and what's not at Dreams:

reviews.text: Our arrival to Puerto Vallarta was a memorable one. Mexico happened to be playing in the World Cup. As such, the security, the baggage handlers, and the immigration was lax. There was a small television playing the game; and I swear all eyes were on the game. Good for us, we passed through immigration within 30 minutes. We also noticed that there were no yellow cabs in the immediate vicinity. I agree with everyone. The white cabs were a bit more; but who cares? It's our 1st day. What's an extra 4 dollars?
reviews.title: Great hotel, but....
Delightful
reviews.text: Upon arrival, we did receive the cold towel, the champagne, and the fresh baked cookies! Nice touch. We did upgrade our room from the old tower to the new tower---a juinior suite with no jacuzzi (Not worth it, I'll explain later). Upon arrival to our room, our key did not work! It did not work the 1st time, the 2nd time, or the 3rd time! It wasn't until the 4th time that they sent a maintenance worker with us. A little inconvenient. But, so what? We're on vacation.

The room was huge! If you ask me, a poor way of utilizing the space. The bathroom, although private was very small (and smelled a bit musty [again no big deal]). There was a lot of dead space. They could've made the restroom a bit larger for more comfort. But otherwise, nice and very clean .
reviews.title: It's a mid-class experience

reviews.text: The bed? It already had the feather bed!
reviews.title: Dreams the Good the bad and the Wedding
Great Location, Great Beach, Great Vacation!

reviews.text: We started planning our wedding 14 months before our wedding day. The hardest part of the whole process was trying to choose a resort that was going to appeal to everyone attending. We did not get married at the Dreams resort but decided to stay there because of the great beach location and the affordability. It was really important that we found an affordable resort with out giving up too much in regards to the quality of food, cleanliness and service. Our group consisted of 28 people travelling from Edmonton, Calgary, and Vancouver.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Airport:
reviews.title: Constantly felt that they were trying to upsell us

reviews.text: Everything went really smoothly when we arrived at the airport. The reps for Air Transat were waiting right out side the doors as soon as we left the baggage claim area. We were lead to our transfer bus and left almost immediately.
reviews.title: The Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in:
reviews.title: our Honeymoon!
